intro: Heteromalla, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often intricate floral structures that resemble spiders, hence its common name. These plants are native to various regions in Australia and are known for their striking, showy blooms. Heteromalla species typically have tall, slender stems and are often epiphytic or lithophytic, growing on trees or rocks. They play an important role in their ecosystems and are valued for their ornamental beauty.
